intro: Calamovilfa curtissii, commonly known as the Curtiss' panicgrass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, wiry stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, two-lobed flowers. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
